reviews.review_msg: overall good prof. marking was a little slow and not by her own fault the TAs were pretty useless. exams were hard but pretty fair. good OH, solid lectures, and pretty good assignments.

Jocelyn Minns was the last second substitute for CMPT 225 and taught the course for the first time when I had her. She made very clear powerpoints and her lectures were absolute amazing. She would go in depth on some practice problems which really helped. Exams were very fair and grading wasn't too tough. By far my favourite CS prof.

Jocelynn was a pleasure to have as a prof. She went out of her way to help me with tough concepts, walk through dense code and nail down concepts, often outside of normal office hours, never making me feel like my questions were stupid even when they probably were. HIGHLY recommend!

I am not sure if Jocelyn has a permanent position at SFU but I really hope she is given one. You can tell she cares about students and is passionate about teaching as she gives students manageable expectations about assignments and exams. I hope to see more new professors like her in the comp sci department who actually want to see students succeed
